RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 47. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR ACCREDITED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAYBETHEONE broke in full stride to set all the pace, widened into the stretch under mild right handed urging and won as much the best. DANZANITEAWAY unhurried early, closed willingly in the five path through deep stretch and finished clear for second. B SASSI was forced out bumping OH GLORIOUS DAY at the start, chased the winner along the inside and went evenly. NANCYFROMTHEBLOCK failed to menace. OH GLORIOUS DAY was bumped at the start then lacked the needed response. MOBIL DREAM STAR found her best stride late. PITY PURCHASE was a sharp threat outside through the turn and weakened late. VICTORIA COMMAND was outrun. LUCKY STUFF bore out at the start, had speed through the turn then wilted. RIVERS RUN RED was no threat. COWGIRLS HUMOR was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Stuff
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore out start, speed turn, wilted

ENTRY.NAME: B Sassi
ENTRY.OWNER: Gregg Hoover LLC and H5 Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out, bumped start, vied inside, evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Danzaniteaway
ENTRY.OWNER: Barker Scott W and Barker Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, closed willingly 5path, clear second

ENTRY.NAME: Maybetheone
ENTRY.OWNER: Sparks Jerry S and Lopez Juana
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led throughout, full of run, much the best,

ENTRY.NAME: Mobil Dream Star
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Jeffery D and Schenk Joseph

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 46. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR ACCREDITED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOCIAL HISTORY set a pressured pace from two wide to the top of the lane, responded when called upon to open a clear advantage and drew off as much best. C V DYNAMIC reserved off the early pace, split rivals in the turn under a drive, angled four wide coming home and closed well to be second best. LIVING THE DREAM stalked the pace from three wide through the turn, angled in to the rail down the lane and finished willingly for the show. VECCHI pressed the pace from the rail to the quarter pole, drifted out in the stretch while tiring. RIVERS OF DENIRO rushed up the rail to be with the early lead and flattened out in the turn. PLAYFULASITGETS went one-paced failing to menace. KELLEHER dropped back through the turn and was never a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Rivers of Deniro
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: C V Dynamic
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, split rivals, long drive, angled 4w, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Vecchi
ENTRY.OWNER: Spicer, Richard and Spitler, D. William
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, inside, drift out, tiring

ENTRY.NAME: Social History
ENTRY.OWNER: Nelson Kathryn and Nelson Jim E
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, 2 wide, cleared, drew off, much best

ENTRY.NAME: Living the Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3 wide, angled in, up for show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 83. Starter Allowance Purse 22900. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $7,500 OR LESS IN THE LAST 5 STARTS. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 28 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Multiple Winners In 2023 Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RECKLESS L J never far back, advanced steadily three then two wide under mild right handed urging and was along in time. MASTEROFTHEHOUNDS sprinted to the lead soon after the start, set all the pace then couldn't handle the winner in the final stages. HENRY THE CAT allowed to settle, finished with good courage inside. TIGER TRAIL stalked the pace along the inside through the turn, shifted out to the seven path at the top of the stretch then faded. SERENDIPITOUS passed tiring rivals. POWERFUL PHIL failed to menace. PRIVATE DRIVE was outrun. ROSCO P. COLTRANE bobbled outward at the start, was a sharp threat outside through the turn then gave way on the stretch. WORTHY OPPONENT pressed the early pace four then three wide into the turn, stopped abruptly in the stretch, was eased to the wire and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Henry the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, finished well inside

ENTRY.NAME: Masterofthehounds
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, set pace, shook clear, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Worthy Opponent
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 4-3wide, stopped, eased to wire, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Reckless L J
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, steady advance, 3 wide, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Rosco P. Coltrane
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled outward start, outside speed, gave way lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 41. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR ACCREDITED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SADIE'S SILVER KID prompted the pace to midway on the turn, assumed command turning for home, pulled clear inside the sixteenth pole in a determined drive. COUNTEVERYBLESSING stalked the pace from three wide through the turn, loomed at he head of the lane and finished willingly while unable to go with the winner. JUSTA LITTLE MOORE tracked the leaders from four wide and rallied down the lane to just miss the place. SEEKING FREEDOM broke outward leaving the gate, rated in mid-pack to the quarter pole, rallied in upper stretch and finished evenly. TAHLEQUAH JOE set the early pace from the rail and weakened through the stretch. STRIKING LAD tracked the pace from the outside and failed to gain ground in the lane. REIGNING DREAM showed brief speed to be prominent early, dropped back in the turn and never posed a threat. DREAMINGABOUTTIME trailed throughout. ONE STEP ASIDE squeezed at the start, clipped heels several strides from the gate and unseated his rider, galloped around the track crossing the wire and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Seeking Freedom
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outward, rated mid-pack, bid mid-stretch, even late

ENTRY.NAME: One Step Aside
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start, clipped heels, lost rider, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Sadie's Silver Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, assumed command, cleared, determined

ENTRY.NAME: Justa Little Moore
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 4 wide, mild bid, missed place

ENTRY.NAME: Reigning Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed, dropped back, no threat,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 71. Starter Allowance Purse 22900. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $7,500 OR LESS IN THE LAST 5 STARTS. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 28 Allowed 2 lbs. (Race s Where Entered For $6,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Multiple Winners In 2023 Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVA POWER stalked the pace three wide, made the lead two wide early on the turn, quickly opened a daylight advantage, set the balance of the pace and prevailed under strong handling. ROLLIN ALL THE WAY stalked the pace along the inside into the turn, improved position two wide before a half and finished clear for second. STATUS SYMBOL allowed to settle, had a mild late rally along the inside. LADY ABRIL allowed to settle, closed some ground outside rivals into the stretch then failed to sustain that bid. TALE OF THE LYON set a pressured pace two wide into the turn and was through after a half. HIGHLY EXPLOSIVE well placed, failed to respond. SARAH JANE was no threat. APPEALING SENORITA was no factor. BEEBLEGEE was outrun. PISTOL PACKIN BOS pressed the early pace along the inside and stopped on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Rollin All the Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta's Racing Stable and Trusso Tony
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, middle move, 2 wide, clear second

ENTRY.NAME: Tale of the Lyon
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, 2 wide, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Status Symbol
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, mild rally late inside

ENTRY.NAME: Diva Power
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed 3wide, quick move 2wide turn, drew off, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Abril
ENTRY.OWNER: Yoder Susan and Rivera Alan Yahir
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, outside, failed to sustain bid,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Distaff S. MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Registered Ohio Breds. $50 to nominate. $350 to enter and $650 to start. Purse to be divided: 60% to the winner; 20% to second; 10% to third; 5% to fourth; 3% to fifth; 2% to sixth. Weights: Three-Year-Ol ds 119 lbs.; Older 122 lbs. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. At scratch time the field will be limited to fourteen (14) horses. Preference determined by money earned. Eligible horses racing at least once in Ohio dur ing 2023 credited with 2022 and 2023 earnings. Non-starters in Ohio during 2023 credited with 2023 earnings only. Trophy presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CANDLELIGHT HOURS stalked the pace from the fence to the far turn, was called upon midway on the bend to maintain position and not be boxed in, took command turning for home, cleared the pacesetter in upper stretch, shied from the gate tire tracks in the lane and was kept to task late in the drive while much best. R THREE ANGELS hustled away from the gates to open a clear lead into the first turn, maintained the advantage to the head of the lane and kept on well to be second best while no match for the winner. MARKET SUCCESS tracked the leaders from four wide into the far turn to be within striking distance and lacked a closing response when called upon. SPARKLING JEWEL well placed just off the pacesetter into the turn racing in the three path, tried to go with the winner in the turn matching strides to the quarter pole and flattened out for the drive. SONNET trailed throughout and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Candlelight Hours
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, early drive, assumed command, shied tire tracks

ENTRY.NAME: Sparkling Jewel
ENTRY.OWNER: WinStar Farm LLC and Blazing Meadows Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, 2 wide, bid turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: R Three Angels
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled, clear lead, kept on, no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio John W. Galbreath S. MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR FILLIES, TWO YEARS OLD. Registered Ohio Breds. $50 to nominate. $350 to enter and $650 to start. Purse to be divided: 60% to the winner; 20% to second; 10% to third; 5% to fourth; 3% to fifth; 2% to sixth. Weight: 119 lbs. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. At scratch time the field will be limited to fourteen (14) horses. Preference determined by money earned. Trophy presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HERE'S THE SPIDER slow early to trail into the first turn, steadily made up ground down the backside to be in striking distance, circled four wide at the quarter pole consistently closing ground and prevailed late in the drive to be clear at the wire. CITY SCENE prompted the pace down the backside, assumed command into the far turn, dueled with PRACTICALLLYELUSIVE from the five-sixteenths pole to the wire, coming out late in the drive to bump that one and held on gamely for the place. PRACTICALLYELUSIVE tracked the pace from three wide down the backside while resisting rider's restraint, moved to engage the leader in the turn, battled with the frontrunner down the lane, was bumped late in the drive when that one drifted out and finished willingly while unable to get passed. WOMAN'S DREAM raced up between horse down the backside to be prominent, lost position nearing the half mile pole, ranged up in the far turn to threaten and could not sustain the rally. FANCIFUL saved ground for the run to the far turn, angled out to challenge in upper stretch and flattened out down the lane. BIG FACTS dropped back into the first turn to trail down the backside and passed tiring rivals coming home never having menaced. GOLD HONEY showed brief speed through the first turn and came up empty. HISTORYINTHEMAKING flashed speed for the first half mile and stopped entering the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Facts
ENTRY.OWNER: Rankin Bobby R and Johnson Charles W

ENTRY.NAME: Fanciful
ENTRY.OWNER: Four Pillars Holdings LLC and Caraway Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, angled out, bid upper, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Woman's Dream
ENTRY.OWNER: Baccari Chris Dream Walkin Farms Inc MJM Racing and Hutcherson Rob
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost position, middle move, even late

ENTRY.NAME: Here's the Spider
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, steady advance, circled 4w, prevailed late

ENTRY.NAME: City Scene
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, lead, dueled, bumped rival late, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Practicallyelusive
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Snow Racing Stables Boots N Bikinis LLC and Engelhart Joseph M
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, bid 3w, battled, bumped late, not enough

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Juvenile S. MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 71. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS. Registered Ohio Breds. $50 to nominate. $350 to enter and $650 to start. Purse to be divided: 60% to the winner; 20% to second; 10% to third; 5% to fourth; 3% to fifth; 2% to sixth. Weights: Colts and Geldings 122 lbs.; Fillies 119 lbs. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. At scratch time the field will be limited to fourteen (14) horses. Preference determined by money earned. Trophy presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHO DEY never far back, moved up steadily five wide down the backstretch to engage the runner up after a half, matched strides the balance of the trip, drifted out to the seven path through deep stretch and proved best under left handed urging. SHADOWY away alertly, set a pressured pace along the inside into the stretch, dug in determinedly but couldn't handle the winner. DIAL DIRECT stalked the pace near the inside and went evenly. EKATI'S WAY stalked the early pace three then two wide, was bumped past the half mile marker then faded. VILLIAN failed to menace. SCRIMPER checked repeatedly between rivals on the clubhouse turn then was no factor. IRONCLAD ALIBI was fractious in the gate, bumped repeatedly at the start then no threat. GAPPER was always outrun. RADIO SILENT was through after a half. LUCKY VICTOR had brief speed. TOUGH CAT was never involved. KINDERHOOK'S rider lost his left iron at the start, bumped repeatedly with IRONCLAD ALIBI, rushed to contention in the five path on the first turn, drifted in bumping EKATI'S WAY past the half mile pole then stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Villian
ENTRY.OWNER: Blazing Meadows Farm LLC and Hamm Shane

ENTRY.NAME: Ironclad Alibi
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, bumped repeatedly start, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Kinderhook
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost left iron start, bumped repeatedly, speed half, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Shadowy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pressured pace inside, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Who Dey
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, advanced 5w, long drive, drifted, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Ekati's Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Cline Robert Stapleton William Wilkerson Richard and Lucas Robert A

ENTRY.NAME: Radio Silent
ENTRY.OWNER: Winblaze LLC and Forward and Left Stables LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Sprint S. MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 9 6F Dirt CR: 98. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD. Registered Ohio Breds. $50 to nominate. $350 to enter and $650 to start. Purse to be divided: 60% to the winner; 20% to second; 10% to third; 5% to fourth; 3% to fifth; 2% to sixth. Weights: Three-Year-Olds 119 lbs.; Older 122 lbs.; Fillies and Mares allowed 3 lbs. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. At scratch time the field will be limited to fourteen (14) horses. Preference determined by money earned. Eligible horses racing at leaston ce in Ohio during 2023 credited with 2022 and 2023 earnings. Non-starters in Ohio during 2023 credited with 2023 earnings only. Trophy presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TROJAN TALE was hung five wide down the backstretch, surged four wide to gain a narrow lead before a half, matched strides the length of the stretch and proved best by a narrow margin under brisk handling. DIAMOND DUST was hustled to the lead while drifting to the seven path soon after the start, battled the entire trip and just failed in a game effort three wide. STARTDFROMDABOTTOM never far back, swung wide and was steadily gaining ground late five wide. TIVIS unhurried early, swung wide and rallied determinedly outside rivals six wide. MR LOOOCH contested the lead two wide and was outfinished in the final stages. DANEFIELD battled for the early lead along the inside, dropped back a bit on the turn, came on again along the rail the rail through upper stretch then was outfinished. AUTHENTIC COWTOWN failed to menace. COUNTRY CLUB BOBBY well placed, failed to respond. CHIEF BUCKEYE was no threat. ALTISSIMO battled for the lead three then two wide into the stretch and weakened late. MO DONT NO was no factor. RAISE THE PURSES was outrun. UNBRIDLED CAUSE had brief speed.

ENTRY.NAME: Diamond Dust
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled lead, drifted 7path, dueled, just failed, 3wide

ENTRY.NAME: Danefield
ENTRY.OWNER: Bourke, W. John, Barbee, Jeff and Kerins, James
ENTRY.COMMENT: battled inside, dropped back turn, came again, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Authentic Cowtown
ENTRY.OWNER: McDonald James H and Authentic Racing LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Tivis
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, swung wide, rallied determinedly outside

ENTRY.NAME: Startdfromdabottom
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, swung wide, late gain, 5 wide, good effort,

ENTRY.NAME: Trojan Tale
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide backstretch, dueled, wore down rivals, gamely,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Best of Ohio Endurance S. MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 10 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 95. Stakes Purse 100000. FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD. Registered Ohio Breds. $50 to nominate. $350 to enter and $650 to start. Purse to be divided: 60% to the winner; 20% to second; 10% to third; 5% to fourth; 3% to fifth; 2% to sixth. Weights: Three-Year-Olds 119 lbs.; Older 122 lbs. Fillies and Mares allowed 3 lbs. Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. At scratch time the field will be limited to fourteen (14) horses. Preference determined by money earned. Eligible horses racing at least on ce in Ohio during 2023 credited with 2022 and 2023 earnings. Non-starters in Ohio during 2023 credited with 2023 earnings only. Trophy presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAIR AND SQUARE stalked the pace three wide for six furlongs, made the lead, set the balance of the pace and widened through the stretch under strong handling to win as much the best. TANTRUM was bumped at the start, allowed to settle, rallied determinedly three wide through the stretch and got up for second. RAVEN MOON unhurried early, offered a strong bid along the inside into the stretch then was outfinished for second. I WANNA WIN pressed the pace two wide for a half, made the lead, set the pace into the far turn then weakened in the stretch. SILENCE allowed to settle along the rail, was in tight nearing the far turn then passed tiring rivals late along the inside. FOREWARNED failed to menace. WICKED WARRIOR bore out at the start bumping TANTRUM, was well placed, angled inward nearing the far turn causing a chain reaction of rivals to his inside being in tight then weakened. DARK VADER settled two wide, was in tight nearing the far turn causing his rider to check and lost momentum. GONE IN A FLASH was no factor. SERVE REVENGE COLD set the pace for a little over a half, was forced in past the seven sixteenths pole then flattened out. DERBY INCLUDED was never involved. THE STEWARDS POSTED THE INQUIRY SIGN BUT TOOK NO ACTION.

ENTRY.NAME: Silence
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside, in tight 7/16pole, passed tiring rivals rail

ENTRY.NAME: Dark Vader
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, in tight 7/16pole, checked, lost momentum

ENTRY.NAME: I Wanna Win
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, led, weakened, lane

ENTRY.NAME: Serve Revenge Cold
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta Racing Stable and Sadey David
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace, forced in 7/16pole, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Fair and Square
ENTRY.OWNER: WinStar Farm LLC and Blazing Meadows Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rallied 3 wide, took charge 2nd turn, much the best

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Blazing Meadows Farm LLC & WinStar Farm, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore out, bumped start, angled in 7/16pole, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Tantrum
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, settled, late rally, 3 wide, up place
